intro: Pedicularis contorta var. ctenophora, commonly known as the twisted beard vetch, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with a distinctive hooded shape that attracts specific pollinators. The variety ctenophora is distinguished by its finely toothed leaves and elongated, twisted floral structure.
